title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A burst sprinkler pipe displaced hundreds of UMass Boston students from East Residence Hall due to flooding.
Approximately 50 rooms on floors 2-10 were damaged, forcing the university to extend the building's 'no occupancy' status.
UMass Boston is offering temporary housing and plans to reopen the East Residence dining hall on Wednesday.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library recommended over 35 book titles to Boston Public Library after Seahawks' Super Bowl victory.
Recommendations included Michael Bennett's memoir and an economics book titled 'Inflation' by Mark Blyth and Nicolö Fraccaroli.
Both libraries support Books Unbanned, promoting teens' rights to read without censorship nationwide.

title: State auditor sues Beacon Hill to force compliance with audit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio sues Beacon Hill to enforce her authority to audit the State Legislature.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell refused to support DiZoglio's lawsuit, questioning the auditor's authority to conduct the audit.
House Speaker Ronald Mariano and Senate President Karen Spilka are named defendants in the suit seeking legislative compliance.

title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, was arrested in Seaport on charges of human trafficking and related offenses.
The arrest followed a sting operation by the Boston Police Human Trafficking Unit and State Police.
Macean will be arraigned in South Boston District Court after his arrest near Seaport Boulevard and Thompson Place.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Eastern coyotes are frequently spotted in Boston during their mating season from January to March due to winter conditions.
MassWildlife advises residents to secure pets and remove food sources to prevent coyote interactions and ensure safety.
Coyotes are territorial but attacks on humans in Massachusetts are rare, with fewer than 10 incidents in 60 years.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton, former Patriots QB, praised Drake Maye for his progress after previously criticizing him during the 2025 season.
Newton acknowledged Maye's growth towards becoming an MVP candidate despite his struggles in the Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Drake Maye was the MVP runner-up in the regular season, finishing just behind Matthew Stafford of the Rams.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens won the 2026 Beanpot MVP, recording two goals and five points over two games for Boston College.
Boston College defeated Boston University 6-2 in the Beanpot final at TD Garden, securing their first title since 2016.
Bruins prospects Andre Gasseau and Dean Letourneau also contributed, with Gasseau scoring twice and Letourneau adding a goal.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots CB Carlton Davis emphasizes team culture and bright future following Super Bowl LX loss to Seahawks.
Patriots have $42.7M cap space, opportunity to attract free agents, with possible contract extensions affecting budget.
New England's recent success and stable coaching influence poised to make them attractive in free-agent market.

title: Sticker shock for a dealer’s quote to replace a starter
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader received a $1,200 quote from a dealership to replace a starter on a 2014 Honda Accord EX.
John Paul of AAA Northeast advises that the starter's price, including labor, should be around $925.
Dealerships can charge 30-36% more than independent shops; AAA Approved shops are recommended for better pricing.

title: Where will Kristian Campbell play in the field for the Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kristian Campbell will primarily play outfield for the Red Sox in 2026, as confirmed by manager Alex Cora.
Campbell struggled defensively at second base in 2025, posting a minus-16 defensive runs saved.
Campbell's offensive potential remains his main asset, but competition for regular playing time is significant.
